Workshops

The workshops at A Real Space are designed to generate actionable, tangible proposals for how cities can become more equitable, humane, and just. Facilitated by experts, our workshops take the pulse of our collective urban issues and equip others — from professionals and government representatives to activists, entrepreneurs, and engaged citizens — with the tools and environment to address them.

Challenge-Based Learning

A Real Space's workshops employ a challenge-based learning approach, bringing together a heterogeneous, cross-disciplinary group of practitioners, academics, students, and experts to work on a specific urban challenge and propose actions. The workshops begin with a short, provocative introduction of the challenge, after which groups are formed to work on the proposed actions, and then reconvene to share proposals.

Other Workshops

In the interest of experimentation, A Real Space is open to hosting your workshop so long as it is in keeping with our broad commitment to better, fairer urban environments. We can provide you with a space and resources to facilitate your workshop, and you can decide on the format, subject matter, and participants. Get in touch.
